intro: Guatteria korinti, commonly known as the Korinti guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green in color. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by edible, orange-red berries. The botanical features of Guatteria korinti make it an important component of its native ecosystems, supporting various wildlife species.
